title: Pitch deck outline for Hardware Seed startups
summary: Projected deck structure for Hardware founders raising a Seed round. Includes section goals, proof points, and investor expectations for this stage.

sections.title: Problem
sections.goal: Show the pain and why now matters.
sections.guidance: Quantify the problem with a clear market shift or constraint.

sections.title: Solution
sections.goal: Explain the product in one sentence.
sections.guidance: Focus on the core workflow and the wedge you own.

sections.title: Market
sections.guidance: Start with the first buyer segment and a realistic wedge.

sections.title: Traction
sections.guidance: Highlight pilots, LOIs, or early revenue.

sections.title: Business model
sections.guidance: Show pricing logic tied to value delivered.

sections.title: Moat
sections.guidance: Data, IP, approvals, or operational scale.

sections.title: Team
sections.guidance: Emphasize domain expertise and execution history.

sections.title: Manufacturing plan
sections.goal: Describe production and supply chain readiness.
sections.guidance: Highlight partners, tooling, and cost targets.

sections.title: Seed milestones
sections.guidance: Detail the specific milestones investors expect for Hardware Seed.

sections.title: Hardware go-to-market wedge (Seed)
sections.goal: Explain your entry point for Hardware.
sections.guidance: Show a focused wedge that fits Hardware buyers at the Seed stage.

sections.title: Hardware proof points
sections.guidance: Use data or pilots specific to Hardware to prove momentum at Seed.
